topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538d5fc66368727e64580100#post_538d5fc66368727e64580100
No, it's just freight that needs to get somewhere really fast. it can be anything but it's usually factories who needs the parts fast because a machine broke and they need it as fast as possible because they are losing tens of thousands every hour that it is shut down. Other times it's just people who simply need things fast, like a wedding dress that had to be sent back to the tailor for some last-minute changes and the wedding starts in a few hours.

topics.body:
I'm kind of digging transistor despite what people have said about it.

I like the sub-plot of when you think about it the entire world is virtual and that they're virtual entities.

What I mean by this is we're currently working on virtual worms and such so theoretically speaking something like a completely virtual world like the matrix is possible, grant it you're never going to reach the point at which you fool the beings(basically perfectly simulating the laws of physics is near impossible in that it'll cause pixelation to which they'll be able to notice[side note: the scary thing is that in real life there actually is something similar to that so theoretically speaking it's actually possible we're virtual we just haven't realized it yet.  It hasn't been ruled out; it's just unlikely]).

When you get right down to it the transistor is essentially establishing admin access; even one of the attacks is a reference to this.



This does raise a question though; if it turned out the world is a simulation would it really change the fact we are alive or such?  If we are in a simulation then that's a pretty damn powerful computer to compute a infinite number of universes to the point at which those inside can not alter it.  That's like having a server that can run the entire large hadron collider's systems and be so secure to the point at which even if a individual had all the passwords, the source code and the admin left the computer unlocked you still couldn't actually do any damage.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Mankind could be a flawed program and other species are using is to run tests to see what decisions they need to take based on the consequences of what we do. The A.I. Evolves, but never to a point where it reaches the system and is discreetely throw back to prevent an anormal growth.
